title: Chloe Peplow
text:
Chloe Anne Peplow (born 3 December 1998) is an English <a href="Association%20football">football</a> midfielder who plays for <a href="Reading%20F.C.%20Women">Reading</a> in the <a href="FA%20WSL">FA WSL</a>. She has represented England on the under-17 and under-19 national teams.
Playing career.
Birmingham City, 2015–2017.
At the age of 16, Peplow signed with <a href="Birmingham%20City%20L.F.C.">Birmingham City F.C.</a> in December 2014 for the <a href="2015%20FA%20WSL">2015 FA WSL</a> season. She made her debut for the senior team during a 3–0 win over Bristol City on 5 September 2015. After signing her first professional contract with the club and returning for the <a href="2016%20FA%20WSL">2016 FA WSL</a> season, Peplow made 13 appearances for the club. She appeared as a <a href="Substitute%20%28association%20football%29">substitute</a> for <a href="Andrine%20Hegerberg">Andrine Hegerberg</a> in Birmingham's 4–1 <a href="2017%20FA%20Women%27s%20Cup%20Final">2017 FA Women's Cup Final</a> defeat by <a href="Manchester%20City%20W.F.C.">Manchester City</a>.
She was sent on loan to <a href="FA%20WSL%202">FA WSL 2</a> club <a href="Doncaster%20Rovers%20Belles%20L.F.C.">Doncaster Rovers Belles</a> on transfer deadline day in September 2017.
Tottenham Hotspur.
After the loan spell, at <a href="Doncaster%20Rovers%20Belles%20L.F.C.">Doncaster</a>, ended, she left the club to join <a href="FA%20Women%27s%20Super%20League">Super League</a> side, <a href="Tottenham%20Hotspur%20F.C.%20Women">Tottenham Hotspur</a>. Throughout her 2 years at the club, she got 20 appearances in different competitions. She scored 0 goals in these appearances and in the 2021 <a href="Transfer%20window">Transfer Window</a>, she joined the <a href="Reading%20F.C.%20Women">Reading Women's Team</a>.
Reading.
On 8 July 2021, <a href="Reading%20F.C.%20Women">Reading</a> confirmed they had signed the <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> for an undisclosed amount.
International.
Peplow has represented England on the under-15, under-17, and <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">under-19</a> national teams. She competed at the U17 and U19 European Championships.
Honours.
England U20s
